column12: Remote control equipment comprising energy storage equipment
column13: The utility model relates to remote control equipment, which comprises an electric generator (1) and electric energy storage equipment (10), wherein the electric generator (1) is designed for converting mechanical energy into electric energy, and the electric energy storage equipment(10) is connected with the electric generator (1). The electric energy storage equipment (10) comprises a first capacitor (C1), a first switch (S1), a second capacitor (C2) and a second switch (S2), wherein the first capacitor (C1) is connected with the terminal of the electric generator (1), and the first switch (S1) is used for controlling the charging and discharging of the first capacitor (C1). The second capacitor (C2) is connected with the first capacitor (C1), and the second switch (S2) is used for controlling the charging and discharging of the second capacitor (C2). The remote control equipment comprises a sequential control mechanism which is used for controlling the first switch (S1) and the second switch (S2) in succession.

In at least one embodiment, a building material comprising a porous membrane having a moderate to high water vapor permeability and high liquid water penetration resistance is disclosed. The building material may be used in building applications, including as or as part of a building wrap, a rain screen, a roofing underlayment, a flashing, a sound proofing material, or an insulation material. The porous membrane may include at least one thermoplastic polymer, at least one filler, and at least one processing oil. The porous membrane may be flat or may have ribs. The porous membrane may include at least one scrim component.
column15: STAINER MATTHEW;;MILLER ERIC;;WOLSKI MATT;;MUNHOLLON TYLER;;ALEXANDER DANIEL;;FULKERSON GARY

The microporous membrane may be used in building applications, including as or as part of a building wrap, a rain screen, a roofing underlayment, a flashing, a sound proofing material, or an insulation material. column13: In at least one embodiment, a building material is disclosed comprising a porous membrane having moderate to high water vapor permeability and high resistance to liquid water permeability. The building material may be used in building applications, including as or as part of a building envelope, a rainproof screen, a roof liner, a waterproof panel, a sound insulation material, or a thermal insulation material. The porous membrane may include at least one thermoplastic polymer, at least one filler, and at least one processing oil. The porous membrane may be flat or may have ribs. The porous membrane may include at least one base fabric component.

column12: Lens assembly with integrated focus mount and CRT coupler
column13: A lens assembly adapted to be connected to a CRT and affixed to mounting structure in a projection television cabinet. The lens assembly includes a tubular lens mount having a longitudinal axis and at least a first optical lens element mounted along the longitudinal axis. A tubular focus mount extends along the longitudinal axis and fastening and locking structure connects the lens mount to the focus mount after a focus mount position is obtained. A CRT coupler is formed integrally with the focus mount and includes structure for securing a CRT and for securing the coupler to the mounting structure within the television cabinet. A second optical lens element is mounted to the CRT coupler. A flexible bladder may be used to contain coolant fluid between the CRT and the coupler. A flange may be provided to set a Scheimpflug angle between the CRT and the coupler. A clamp plate for the second optical lens element may include a generally rectangular opening providing a 4:3 or 16:9 mask for the image transmitted by the CRT.
column15: GLASSBURN ROBIN STEVEN;;FULKERSON GREGORY E;;LARSON MICHAEL BRIAN;;SNIVELY DAVID MANNING;;DAWES BRIAN LEON;;MEISER DANIEL GERARD;;KEYES DONALD LEE
